rawContent: @michelleferns11 @MhairiHunter No, it's not always the case. Some in the community are proud to be called Gypsy. Many European Roma like my husband are less keen, perhaps because of linguistic association with the Holocaust and because it merges different groups such as Manouche, Kalderesh, even Sinti.

It’s estimated that around 75% of Europe’s gypsy and Roma population were murdered in the Holocaust.

It's not a laughing matter
